intro: Fagara angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan prickly ash, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. Fagara angolensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
